module.p: -(a)ich is a suffix used to create derived verbs from adjectives, nouns and other verbs.

De-adjectival examples –
deug -teen ⇒ deugaich become more than ten
geal white ⇒ gealaich whiten
geur sharp ⇒ geuraich sharpen
mì-chliù infamy, disrepute ⇒ mì-chliùthaich bring into disrepute, disparage, debunk
mìn fine, smooth ⇒ mìnich smoothen, explain
sleamhainn slippery ⇒ sleamhnaich slide, slip

De-nominal examples –
ainm name ⇒ ainmich name
arm weapon ⇒ armaich arm
crìoch fem. end, boundary (pl. crìochan) ⇒ crìochnaich vb. finish, end, complete
dual
curl/lock of hair ⇒ dualaich vb. curl, twist, plait
cuimhne memory ⇒ cuimhnich remember
earail encouragement, caution ⇒ earalaich exhort, warn
faoisid fem. confession ⇒ faoisidich confess
mì-thoil disinclination ⇒ mì-thoilich displease, dissatisfy
stèidh
foundation, base, ground ⇒ stèidhich
establish, found, ground, base

De-verbal examples –
sgar part, sever ⇒ sgaraich separate, divide
